website_summaries.verdict: Next level distortion pedal designed for hard rock and heavy metal sound. Can elevate guitar solos and heavy metal runs.
pros: Has a three-band EQ and level control
Runs on 9-volt battery or DC power supply (not included)
Features multi-gain circuitry that generates thick, tube-like distortion and endless sustain

customer_reviews.title: $25 Vs $135, and $25 holds its ground!!!
customer_reviews.text: Its Kinda a sad day This cheap,(in all essence of the word) Pink-ish(OK I cant lie its dark pink) Behringer pedal, is giving my $135 MXR dime distortion (original not tribute) A beat down.. This is a metal pedal, sounds like Pantera the way I use it...By the number of reviews my opinion should be pointless, But for 25 its a five star, ONE STAR SHOULD BE knocked for the color and plastic casing,But at $25 I feel like a jerk for even thinking that OOOOverall I will be picking up a few more Behringer pedals in the future, I do believe~~~~ Also picked up their EQ pedal, its nice but not familiar with it to give an opinion yet
customer_reviews.author: Arfo Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price and then some.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. 25$!!! Truly a good buy. I prefer this pedal over my DS-1 as far as tone is concerned. Better equalizer control over a single tone knob. More punchier gain with everything set to 12 o’clock. FYI for active pickups use a little less level and distortion and you won’t feedback so much. Yes it’s plastic... but who cares. You can buy two of these for the price of a DS-1, and 4 for the price of a MT-2. Who jumps on their pedals anyways. Worth it. Don’t hesitate. It’s more of a Magenta, not Hot Pink according to the pics.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the money
customer_reviews.text: Decent distortion, hard to find a happy medium where the effect isn't noisy or too much bottom end. I adjusted the level and that helped but my line 6 amplifi 150 distortion sounds much better coupled with the built in effects. This is still a great quality pedal and the price point is incredible for what u get. I think this pedal would kick ass with the behringer eq pedal. Definitely has some balls to it tho and would make a good addition to someone's pedal board or a stand alone distortion stomp.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle P

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, feels decent. Be gentle.
customer_reviews.text: It sounds great and makes a great additional distortion pedal. It is a great clone of the Boss Metal Zone pedal for a fraction of the cost. However with the lower price comes some short comings. The housing is entirely plastic except for a metal plate on the bottom of the pedal housing to give it weight. I don't feel it will break with casual and light use, i don't suggest really giving it a good stomp on stage. If your gentle and within reason of the build quality, it can and will last a long time. The sound can be dialed in with relative ease and the sound produced i have no complaints about.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley M.

customer_reviews.title: Killer Pedal
customer_reviews.text: Cannot beat this pedal for the price at all, great for anyone. Very fine adjustments to really dial in your metal tone. You can play grindy lows and scorching highs and everything in between. The construction is solid, knobs are tight but smooth, body is plastic so dont go stomping on this thing like you are godzilla. Also be sure to add a power supply if you dont already have one. It wont take long to drain the battery ( about 12 hours) and by the time you purchase 4 9v batteries you are already at the price point of a power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck if money is funny!
customer_reviews.text: What a bargain! If money is funny, this is definitely the pedal to get! The sound is awesome and very customizable from light to heavy sounding. It compares amazing to pedals that are double, even quintuple (5x!) the price. This pedal is the best bang for buck and great for beginners to old pros. The price is right and the quality is excellent. Behringer is a great company that produces solid pdoducts. I applaud them and their amazing effort to get great sounding and functioning pedals to the masses. Thanks! Good luck everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sweet! Just played around with it for 1st time and i learned i dont need my compression sustain pedal anymore. I found you will wanna back off on the distortion knob a lil but i still am amazed at what is coming outta my crappy lil 15 watt amp. I would recommend to anyone in my situation without a amp that has good distortion as a fix till u can get better amp at very least.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar guy

customer_reviews.title: Good for any price. Awesome for $25
customer_reviews.text: I am not a guitar expert but I enjoy playing at home. I own several pedals usually I pay $100 or more for each and this is as good as any other. Super fun metal tones, responsive equalizer, specially the mids, even the color is much better than the pictures (not as bright). I use it with a power source so I cannot say about how hard is to put the 9v battery on. Now I might give another Behringer pedals a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Hernan

customer_reviews.title: Great distortion pedal for the bucks.
customer_reviews.text: This Pedal is crazy, it has so many fine tuning and the sounds is very good. I owned a couple of distortion pedals in my time and honestly this economical pedal sounded better than some of the more expensive ones they try to get you to buy at your favorite guitar stores. It is made of plastic but its pretty strong and will last you a while. I am mainly playing some black metal with this pedal but I switched it up to some death metal and sounded awesome with my 8 string guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M

customer_reviews.title: Only draw back is the power.
customer_reviews.text: As a metal effects pedal, this thing is great. It is quite cheaply designed, and costs accordingly, but the sound is fine - I appreciate the extra mid control as well. I'm knocking a star off for draining a 9V bolt battery overnight when the pedal was left plugged in. You HAVE to unplug the pedal if using a battery. Also - no DC cable nor battery is included which means you can't use the device out of the box, which these days is simply ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: A++!nailed it perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing guitar since the age of 12 and am a huge kiss fan.that being said I've bought so many of these pedals over the years and tried many amps but I've never been able to duplicate the early kiss sound until now.$20 really?to many people whine about these being plastic?I also have the od 300 that gets you ac dc.never broke one yet!thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.author: andy brooks

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal.
customer_reviews.text: I like this pedal! I use it with my squire bullet, and epiphone les paul special. Sounds good. Make sure you have a decent amp for the output since I can sound really messy in loud volumes.
customer_reviews.author: Luis R.

customer_reviews.title: Get more for your buck. Thing rocks and drives!
customer_reviews.text: Becoming a Behranger fan. Awesome electronics used like the big boys, MXR, DOD, the draw back being the plastic case, which none of the ones I own over the last year or more have broken yet! The dound is comparable to the big boys and I'm sorry I love top notch equipment, but I wont spend a hudred bucks more for a name!
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Connell

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Considering it is a $25 pedal, it has a lot better tone than I expected. I get an old school metal core and punk feel from it. Yeah, it's a little grainy at times but it could be a lot worse. If you are a person that is concerned about color, it's more of a magenta than a pink. I'm a little sad about that because a neon pink would have been awesome. Yet, that does not effect how good the pedal actually is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sick Metal Pedal
customer_reviews.text: I have alot of cheaper distortion and effects pedals and I end up going to this one most often even over some better quality more known ones. Has a great assortment of knobs and options. Crank high frequency and the mids and get a crazy metal sound. Or you can turn down the distortion and frequency knobs and get a cool high gain effect. Love it. I have a few Behringer pedals, the casings are definitely cheap but the sounds are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Joe LoonyTone

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Unit! Low Bass Crunch! Long Live Rock-Bang Your Head! Not your Gen Z "who are they again"
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best sounding Distortion units I have used. It's very versatile with an expanse range of highs and lows. Go low freq...and still maintain that gut wrenching crisp crunch. I spent about 3 hours just hitting muffled strings in amazement of how good I was! The unit housing itself is made of plastic, but no doubt the money saved there went into sound quality development.
customer_reviews.author: James Score

customer_reviews.title: 25 dollars and it makes your guitar EVIL...
customer_reviews.text: Bestest pedal ever.. This thing will turn your guitar into a bone crushing assault weapon and make it sing notes like an ex baby mama wantin money on Tuesday.. its that good and the best part its only twenty five dollars.. I loooooovvveee it I turn the lows all the way up you will love this pedal I promise!! The analog delay is also sweet.. Whoo hoo thanks behringer!!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Behringer makes some great guitar pedals
customer_reviews.text: Behringer makes some great guitar pedals, they are as close to Boss pedals as you can get, and they are a lot cheaper too. Some complain about the plastic housing, but I think for the amount of money you save it's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Mcwalmart

customer_reviews.title: Awesome For The Price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome peddle for the price. Sounds great with plenty of options to adjust the sound just right. Works great with the 9 volt battery and is easy to install. I can really get that rock and metal sound I'm looking for by taking the time to set the knobs just right. I'm having a lot of fun with it and would recommend this. Rock on!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Furtado

customer_reviews.title: Completely Surprised!!
customer_reviews.text: This pedal sounds awesome with only using a very small fender practice amp & cheapo electric guitar! Better than some of my much more expensive gear & larger amp setups Ive had in the past. I hope it holds up & lasts. will let you know if it doesn't!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this peddle!!!
customer_reviews.text: As with anything when you look at the price you figure it will be mediocre at best. I plugged this thing in and put a basic setting to the knobs and i was really amazed. This pedal has great adjustable sound that my guitar amp distortion just couldnt seem to give. You can dial in just the sound you want for so many different sounds. Super happy and would buy again anyday!!!
customer_reviews.author: Knobster

customer_reviews.title: When paired with the RIGHT amp - or direct, this pedal shines!
customer_reviews.text: At first, I didn't like this pedal. It seemed WAY too treble-heavy. Then, I learned how to pair it with the right amp - or plug it direct into Reaper on my PC. This pedal is great for all sorts of modern rock and classic metal/rock applications! For $25, it's a steal!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: If you are new to pedals, and/or you don't ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are new to pedals, and/or you don't want to spend a small fortune on boutique pedals, these are the answer. They are not made of the sturdiest material, but if you are just playing around in your room they are perfect
customer_reviews.author: KyleE

customer_reviews.title: It is a very nice pedal for the price
customer_reviews.text: I don't play out anymore and just wanted something for home use. It is a very nice pedal for the price. If you want an alternative to a Heavy Metal pedal, this could work for you. You can get a nice sound if you play with it a little bit. You need to pull the plugs out after you use it or the battery will die.
customer_reviews.author: NJMF16

customer_reviews.title: now that I use it with a better amp, it sounds very processed and artificial in ...
customer_reviews.text: It sounds very artificial, I remember first getting this pedal and really loving the sound and kick it had, now that I use it with a better amp, it sounds very processed and artificial in sound that it's not even worth the price I payed for it before. I also had bought another one to replace the first one because the input section jack got messed up in the amp that it didn't want to lock with my guitar cable and when I took it apart, there was no way for me to fix it other than sending it to be replaced. Shitty pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Aragon

customer_reviews.title: This pedal sounds fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: This is another home run for Behringer. You must keep in mind that the plastic these are made of is cheap and will not put up with much abuse. But if you're just looking for great sound on a budget, they are great. The tone sculpting you can do with four tone knobs is outstanding. I just sat playing it all night and never getting bored. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sean L

customer_reviews.title: Should be 3.5 stars but hey
customer_reviews.text: It’s just a discounted boss metal dist. If you like metal but don’t play ina band it’s good. if you play metal live in front of people naw get something better unless you’re broke it really doesn’t sound dank, but what do I know I’m just a normal human being 😂😂 I don’t play live I just record for studio on my pc and it works with touch ups from FL 3 star at best but 4 cause I payed for it and I don’t really wanna be dissapointed with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Ya boi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pedal for its price
customer_reviews.text: This pedal is a pretty good pedal admittedly. I wanted to look for a good pedal for a low price and this pedal is definitely that. I've tried distortion pedals that cost $100+ and honestly, this stands well with them. I only have one complaint, I wish it was made out of metal instead of plastic. But all in all, for only $25, you really can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for price.. Put battery in.. Didn't work.. U was gonna return it.. Opened it up to see if anything was loose.. Looked like decent electronics inside.. Something must have been a little loose and unit then worked.. Not great sounds.. But for the money I think it's not bad
customer_reviews.author: chad r

customer_reviews.title: Love me some Behringer!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this pedal. Similar products go for well over $100 and don't offer the range of adjustability as this pedal has. I couldn't believe how much sound this puts out and how well it works. I now have 3 Behringer pedals. You absolutely cannot beat the value for. The price.
customer_reviews.author: Maxmilian P Goppert

customer_reviews.title: No quality
customer_reviews.text: Undefined sound. I tried to make the adjustments anyway but I did not succeed. I am disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Violy

customer_reviews.title: LASTED 4 YEARS SO FAR
customer_reviews.text: I've had this since October of 2014 when i was 14 years old. And it's lasted that entire time. I like to play metalcore and deathmetal songs and when I've jammed with friends it is very loud and very thick. My only complain is that pressing it feels like it lags and doesn't feel smooth. But you just have to press it hard and press it focused. Maybe that;s how the other pedals are idk. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Sanchez Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Because mine seems to be damaged and easily turns I and off with a light touch
customer_reviews.text: I am giving it 4, luckily not 3. Because mine seems to be damaged and easily turns I and off with a light touch. Also, the box lid wasn't attached to the bottom inside the package. I give it 4 cause i don't think it came from the manufacturer like that, but was damaged during shipping. But none the less, other than it being plastic instead of an alloy/metal, the sound is good you should be able to get the sound/tone you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jamal G Saxton

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great price.
customer_reviews.text: This pedal sounds great. Real solid heavy metal distortion. If you want a great sound, and a great price, then this metal pedal is definitely for you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Does everything far more expensive pedals do. Other reviews point out the plastic body as a possible issue but it doesn't feel fragile. Yes metal construction is more sturdy but you'd have to throw this pedal hard or literally try to smash it. Normal use shouldn't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Chawanga Butter

customer_reviews.title: Dud
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t last 2 months. Made a pop sound, now it has a short in it. I was super delicate with it because of the plastic, no distortion left just feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Warren McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great budget friendly Distortion Petal
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a present for my boyfriend a few months ago. Creates a good sound for the money. Was a bit skeptical of the plastic construction at first, but after months of use has held together exceptionally well without any signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R.

customer_reviews.title: I WANNA ROCK!
customer_reviews.text: I like this pedal. It has more of a classic overdrive tone than a heavy metal tone. The pink color makes it easy to see in low light scenarios.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Collins

customer_reviews.title: Crap Junk Poopie
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Pawn it or trash it, but don't use it. There is nothing metal about it, not even the box, casing, knobs, or tone.
customer_reviews.author: Marek Sokt

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and incredible
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a Gnarly Metal distortion look no further. The price is insane for the sound quality. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Super-Niezgoda

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest sounding pedal, but for 25 bucks it's a good cheap buy if you just need something to practice with! It's perfect for me at the moment and serves it's purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: E.C.

customer_reviews.title: I own two, enough said.
customer_reviews.text: I have two pedal boards and i own two of these. Any questions?
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Noisy.
customer_reviews.text: My rig makes a lot of unwanted noise when this pedal is connected. Tone is passable, but I have to gate very heavily to cut the noise out.
customer_reviews.author: Konrad976

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived on time but would not work. Took ...
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time but would not work. Took off the casing and it appears the manufacturing of this particular item was sub-par. Was not able to fix on my own, returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda McDTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Cheap metal zone
customer_reviews.text: Metal zone clone. Really good through the fx loop. Pretty cheap feeling, but for the price, it’s worth it. Longs you don’t beat the living hell out of it i think it will last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a jet engine...in a bad way.
customer_reviews.text: While the distortion sounds OK, the tone controls are unbelievably noisy. I barely tweeked the low end control and it sounded like someone plugged a jet engine into my Amp. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: FAP

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Great pedal, all you need to play your favorite music
customer_reviews.author: Kio 1985

customer_reviews.title: Made of plastic but still sounds great
customer_reviews.text: For the price you cannot beat it. I can dial in my tone exactly how I want at low and high volumes. There is feedback with maximum distortion and volume but for a practice amp or small gig/studio you can’t go wrong I attached a video of me playing and the tone I chose -Denny Michaels professional tattooer/singer songwriter
customer_reviews.author: NobilityTattoo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had a Metal Zone back in the 90s. This sounds really tinny and my1/4" cable falls out of the input jack with the slightest tug. I've had better luck with joyo pedals. I thought this one would be similar quality to those, but nope. 2 stars because at least it's cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Riely

customer_reviews.title: Basically my favorite distortion pedal ever
customer_reviews.text: HOLY COW if you want a good distortion pedal for your killer metal licks, than this is the one. I mean why buy a friggin overpriced Metal Zone or whatever (more than three times the price, I mean WTF) when you can have this AMAZING PURPLE (kind of disappointed it isn't as hot pink in person as it looks in the photos) SHRED MASTER BOX?! Haven't gone on tour with it yet, so not sure about durability, but at the cost of these things, they're practically disposable. GET IN THE ULTRA ZONE AND GET MASTER SHREDDIN YALL chuggachugga bam
customer_reviews.author: Joebot

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: I had this for about a week and it started with all kinds of noises, complete garbage. I give it one star because it came on time
customer_reviews.author: daniel mincey

customer_reviews.title: Use as a preamp for best sound
customer_reviews.text: Guitar > pedal > power amp in Or Guitar > pedal > return Money to performance ratio is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Its what I expected, inexpensive and sounds like it. But thats all I wanted to do was to make some noise. If I were gigging Id spend the money and get the Boss. So, if your in the garage or basement this does the job. BTW hang the battery line out of the box for a quick and easy change!
customer_reviews.author: Lasalle

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: did not work.. had to return.. Replacement came.. its dead too.. Tried New battery and a power cord... NOTHING...
customer_reviews.author: gregg jay

customer_reviews.title: Simple metal pedal At Your Service!
customer_reviews.text: I'm playing this out of my Marshall Half Stack at home. This is a great pedal for the money. If you don't want to do 15,000 reviews on pedals but want a good metal sound look no further. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sammer

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it. I love metal, and for a beginner, you couldn't ask for better for under $39 wow
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap, it works just like you want it for an entry level pedal. I would buy more behringer. I'm new at guitar and this is fun to play with along with my black star fly 3 mini amp. Quite the sound combo for under $100 for amp and pedal. Don't waste your time on the battery though. Just buy a power cord.
customer_reviews.author: jordan alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Lots of crunch
customer_reviews.text: Good value and lots of punchy chugging to be produced. Tie this with the TM300 and you got yourself an over the top metal mayhem line up. Just make sure you use a noise gate after.
customer_reviews.author: BCengineer

customer_reviews.title: This little pedal is pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This little pedal is pretty good for the price. It has a good sound that is adjustable to your liking. I have the Digitech death metal pedal and it sounds too digital for my taste. This pedal can produce sounds similar to the death metal pedal if thats what you want, but it is more adjustable. I recommend it to the metal heads ;-)
customer_reviews.author: John E Giroux

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great pedal!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pedal and for the price it gets me the sound I need.
customer_reviews.author: LTD

customer_reviews.title: MetAl!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Batter is annoying to replace/install. Bought a separate 9v charge plug and it’s much better. Glad I bought this, I’ve had a lot of fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: firefly406

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Still experimenting but I liked this peda immediately. I previously used two together to get a sound I liked but this one stands on its on. Also, great for beginner, intermediate players like myself. Really like the great price. To be able to try new pedals and sounds without spending several hundred dollars is great.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy W Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awsome pedal.You can adjust it in high detail.Compared to a "Boss Distortion"..pedal ...This blows it away.
customer_reviews.author: mazzman

customer_reviews.title: No pedal at all is better than this pedal.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of buzz and the destortion isnt any heavevier than what my amp can already put out by itself. To be fair, i do have a cheap amp and a cheap guitar. Shocker, a cheap pedal doesnt make it better. If you have better gear, get a better pedal.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence varnedoe

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money, few dollars more than the other model. More options.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Gives hard metal sound. Buy the adapter though. The batteries won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Fast, fast, fast. Good price. Still learning, so I'm not the best judge. But it has more of that "metal" edge than the "tube" sound ones
customer_reviews.author: Cullen

customer_reviews.title: 🤘🏻
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound for such a low priced pedal. Bought it as my sons entry pedal and am super happy with the sound we’re able to get out of it.
customer_reviews.author: B.D.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Sounds incredible. Even when used with a small practice amp
customer_reviews.author: TJM

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but fun
customer_reviews.text: I like this pedal. It is cheap, made out of plastic, and a Behringer, but it offers a good heavy metal distortion. Sometimes the cheapness gives you that tone that you just can't get out of something high-end. Definitely worth having just to play around with. And having control over the lows, mids, and highs as well is the mid frequency range makes it more than for just distortion. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Schmedes

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Was looking into a tube screamer, but I got this instead. Some people said they had problems accessing the battery area, but they are just stupid. I found battery access simple. I did not use the power pack sold separately, just the 9 volt battery. Nice sound. When effect is off, guitar sounds just like if the pedal was not plugged in. The case is a durable hard plastic. Very happy with purchase, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D2S

customer_reviews.title: Tried two of them and neither worked
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one for my 16 year old son, when it came in could never get it to power up, so we sent it back and tried another and the same thing could never get it to power up with either a 9volt or a power adapter. As far as we are concerned dont waste your time even trying this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, versatile pedal
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pedal, cover all types of metal. So far so good, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Best gain for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This is a great OD pedal dial in any amount of gain, bought 3 one was a dud Amazon refunded fast no problem . Don't let the low price fool you this will turn any amp in to high gain
customer_reviews.author: E. North

customer_reviews.title: Great starter pedal
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this pedal for beginners. It’s fun to play with and has a lot of settings to mess with. This is my first pedal but I think it was a good one to start with. And cheap too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works really nice! I got it for my friend for her ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really nice! I got it for my friend for her birthday and she loves it and uses it all the time. It changes the guitar sound so it is more crunchy and gravely.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Parks-Huitron

customer_reviews.title: Behringer unjustly gets a bad name
customer_reviews.text: This brand gets a bad name simply for how cheap they're able to make their pedals, when they're almost always identical circuit clones of more expensive pedals, just boxed in a hard plastic instead of metal. Love this pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Gives you the best of both the Super Metal and Heavy Metal pedals
customer_reviews.text: Gives you the best of both the Super Metal and Heavy Metal pedals. It is the same price as the other two, but this has both of those pedals in one. If you are looking for a distortion pedal, why not get the one that has the other two built in. Gives you a heavy distorted sound or a high piercing screech and everything in between. A good pedal for a good price. As long as you don't hit it with the legdrop every time you activate it, the plastic casing shouldn't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: It ok
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with ac adaptor or even a part number to order one.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about getting such a cheap distortion pedal, but my god the sound quality is amazing, too bad it doesnt come with the power cord but its ok i bought some 9V batteries at guitar center for $4 so win win. thanks for a cool cheap product
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Vicente

customer_reviews.title: Hands down best introduction into distortion pedals
customer_reviews.text: Hands down best introduction into distortion pedals. Lots of sound and tone range. Bonus it's made out of recycled plastics.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Buhler

customer_reviews.title: I was having bad noise issues but by turning the gain to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Metal for $25? Yes! I was having bad noise issues but by turning the gain to the middle I ended up with a great tone with almost no noise. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Camacho

customer_reviews.title: Nice pedal
customer_reviews.text: People always nag on behringer but i have multiple behringer products in my hone studio and this is the second time they have killed it on the pedals for me, but dear behringer please add a battery door
customer_reviews.author: Possum

customer_reviews.title: Really versatile
customer_reviews.text: Functions great out of the box Is a really great buy and device
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J Wayt

customer_reviews.title: Just What My Son What Looking For!
customer_reviews.text: My son bought this for his first guitar that i bought him for Christmas. Right out of the box everything worked fine. The only thing that i had to do was show him that there was a volume on the pedal itself, not just his amp. He is a beginner, so this worked just fine for him. He is still learning how to strum the cords. I would recommend this product to whoever likes the heavy metal sound.
customer_reviews.author: Lopez Family

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: If you cant save an extra $30 for a much better pedal, than this will work. Not the best sound, but boy does it sound!
customer_reviews.author: Talyorz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed! My Strat and Marshall combo does 98% of what I need, except really heavy stuff. This pedal fills the Gap and gets me the dirt I need for metal with single coil pickups. Take some time to tweak it, and it's worth every penny. (And that's not a lot pennies, which is a plus as well)
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Davis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for $24
customer_reviews.text: Shockingly good for $24.00 Sounds much better than my Peavey combo internal distortion. Play around with the dual mid controls, and be pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: ATAT driver

customer_reviews.title: Packs a really good punch for the price
customer_reviews.text: Can be a seriously hard hitting pedal when maxed out and you cant beat that price. Great for someone who is new to pedals.
customer_reviews.author: King_Gunga

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the Ultra Distortion just to see what the difference was. The distortion has a grungy sound while this has a sharp and crisp sound. I like all the pedals I've bought from Behringer, and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super pedal if you want to play Mattel you cant beat this price!
customer_reviews.author: ronald strew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price paid!
customer_reviews.text: The pedal creates great Metal and Hard Rock distortion for my Stratocaster copy. Plastic housing/foot switch limits the amount of physical abuse it can handle. I would recommend this product for the beginner (like me for example) who does not plan to use it "on the road" for performances.
customer_reviews.author: WCM&Company

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: great stomp box for the money it works great on my fender frontman 212x4 solid state sounds just like a tube amp distortion thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kind of sucks that it comes with no cord and no battery ...
customer_reviews.text: No bangs no dents. Kind of sucks that it comes with no cord and no battery but yolo I guess ... Buy the cord with it . don't be a darsh .
customer_reviews.author: Tom mcgrath

customer_reviews.title: Great Distortion Pedal for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: for this price really can ask for more!!! Great distortion, many options very similarities with Digitech Metal Zone but in an fraction of the price. The Only "Cons" I can tell is the plastic construction is a little weak.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Sounds amazing, does exactly what it's supposed to do and for the price I can't think of a single complaint
customer_reviews.author: David St John

customer_reviews.title: Still rocking after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. It's so versatile and easy to use, and portable. Sounds great, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gav

customer_reviews.title: Big Bang for Buck!
customer_reviews.text: All in all a very solid pedal. Very similar to Boss Mt-2 if not a little warmer. Still kinda hollow though. Just straight gain. I recommend using the gain less than halfway and treble non existent to get a little warmth and to preserve dynamics. Solid design and feel for being plastic. Definitely a good buy but now that I have my crate flexwave half stack with foot switch I no longer use this. Will be buying the behringer noise suppressor now that I know this stuff isnt junk. :)
customer_reviews.author: dustin hansen

customer_reviews.title: Never worked -- and horrible design if you want to use a 9v battery.
customer_reviews.text: The product never worked -- I had to buy a 9v adapter for the thing, and when I plugged it in -- nothing. Nothing. I checked the adapter on another product, and it worked fine -- so the Behringer was the issue. I would also note that you supposedly can use a 9v battery -- but to do that would be a major operation since there is no battery door , and you have to take the thing apart to get to where the battery probably would go. I say "probably" because there are no instructions how to do that. You're pretty much on your own with this one -- assuming you get lucky and get one that works.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: I love this pedal but I suggest going powered not battery
customer_reviews.text: I love this pedal but I suggest going powered not battery .I put batterys in all 4 of mine and the Behringer eats battery over the weekend although it was turned off so did my other beringer peddles
customer_reviews.author: Rob CVole

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal, love that you can adjust very well ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pedal, love that you can adjust very well the mids and the lows so you can get that sound that you like. What I don't like is that the pedal is made from plastic.
customer_reviews.author: BOris

product_meta.title: Behringer Ultra Metal UM300 Heavy Metal Distortion Instrument Effect Pedal,Pink
product_meta.description:
BEHRINGER ULTRA METAL UM300
Heavy Metal Distortion Effects Pedal

 * Take off with the most extreme and sought-after hard rock or heavy metal distortion 
 * This BEHRINGER product has been designed to compete head to head with leading products on the market 
 * Multi-gain circuitry to give you super-thick, tube-like distortion plus endless sustain 
 * Dedicated Distortion, 3-band EQ and Level controls for awesome sound shaping 
 * Blue status LED for effect on/off and battery check 
 * Runs on 9 V battery or the BEHRINGER PSU-SB DC power supply (not included) 
 * First-class electronic On/Off switch for highest signal integrity in bypass mode 
 * High-quality components and exceptionally rugged construction ensure long life 
 * Conceived and designed by BEHRINGER Germany 

In the churning, smoldering world of heavy metal, it's the middle frequencies that make the difference between mush and muscle. With the UM300 ULTRA METAL, you not only get take control of the Mids, you micromanage them! 

METAL TO THE MAX
The UM300 effects pedal gives you the most extreme, sought-after hard rock and heavy metal sounds with super-thick, tube-like distortion - plus virtually endless sustain. 

THE ART OF TONE
Like most distortion stomp boxes, the UM300 comes with DISTORTION and LEVEL controls. And the HIGH and LOW controls let you dial in the amount of top-end and bottom you desire. But the similarity to other stomps ends right there. Much like our world-class mixing consoles, we've given the UM300 a MID FREQ control, allowing you to select a midrange frequency (from 200 Hz to 5 kHz) and boost/cut it by up to 15 dB (that's a lot!). What this means, in terms of tone, is thick, tube-like distortion with endless sustain, for everything from aggressive, traditional metal assaults to bone-crunching mayhem. 

A bright blue LED tells you when the UM300 is active, while a top-quality on/off switch maintains highest signal integrity in bypass mode. You can power the UM300 with our PSU-SB DC power supply (not included), or pop in a 9 V battery. 

MASSIVE IN THE MIDDLE
Is there a hole in the middle of your tone? You'll be surprised how affordably and efficiently the ULTRA METAL UM300 can fill that void. See your BEHRINGER dealer today.
feature_bullets: Take off with the most extreme and sought-after hard rock or heavy metal distortion
This BEHRINGER product has been designed to compete head to head with leading products on the market
Multi-gain circuitry to give you super-thick, tube-like distortion plus endless sustain
Dedicated Distortion, 3-band EQ and Level controls for awesome sound shaping
Status LED for effect on/off and battery check
